data.FLEET_EXPLORE_SEC_FAIL_16: Spores accidentally returned to ship on boots of planetary landing team. Choking vines grew rapidly inside the crew quarters. Forced to initiate controlled burn.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_SEC_FAIL_17: Ground crew reported enormous creatures on the horizon while scouting planet %PLANET%. Spent several days stalking the creatures in attempt to perform detailed scan. Creatures were a mirage.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_SEC_FAIL_18: Deep-space scanner knocked offline by large EMP burst. Crew restored system functionality, but not before event was over. Gathered no data.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_SEC_FAIL_19: Encountered %RACE% freighter in the %SYSTEM% Sector. Freighter was halfway through its self-destruct sequence. Vessel attempted to transmit large data packet. Fleet receiver underpowered, unable to download before freighter exploded.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_SEC_FAIL_20: Discovered anomalies in the ship's log during routine maintenance. Log reports repeated intrusions on network channel 16. No malfunctions or data loss.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_SEC_DAMAGE_1: Ground crew picked flowers while scouting planet %PLANET%. Plants were infested with mineral-eating insects. Creatures got loose in the ship, causing substantial damage to internal components.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_SEC_DAMAGE_2: Crew member attempted to access classified trade data. Performed unauthorised override of ship's archive. Ship AI turned hostile, shorting out core life support systems.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_SEC_DAMAGE_3: Crew member became obsessed with mineral sample gathered on planet %PLANET%. Crew member destroyed important ship components as their obsession turned to rage. Crew member confined to medical bay, mineral sample vented into space.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_SEC_DAMAGE_4: Sent data sample by %RACE% freighter. Crew understood transmission to be trade data. Instead, code was hostile. Vessel was able to hijack core fleet systems and do significant damage.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_1: No activity on long-range scanners. Crew overhauled the secondary reactor shielding.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_2: No activity on long-range scanners. Crew polished the antimatter containers.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_3: No activity on long-range scanners. Crew recalibrated the scanner array. Still no activity on the long-range scanners.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_4: No activity on long-range scanners. Crew stress-tested the holographic containment units.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_5: No activity on long-range scanners. Crew upgraded sensitivity of the gravitational wave detector.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_6: No activity on long-range scanners. Crew performed necessary warp drive maintenance.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_7: No activity on long-range scanners. Controls to manual, ship's AI taken offline for defragmentation.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_8: Strange waveform detected in radar noise. Investigated pattern-like signal, but no intelligent life found.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_9: Severe vibration detected in lead ship's hyperdrive. Performed emergency warp-drop to investigate and repair.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_10: Flightpath distorted by gravity well of nearby black hole. Performed emergency course-correct maneuver. Escaped without damage.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_11: Hyperdrive performed autonomous emergency shutdown. Post-event diagnostics reported no issues. Resumed mission, cautiously.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_12: Hostile lifeform boarded ship while landed on planet. Emergency hardlocks activated. Entered orbit, vented both lifeform and its egg sacs into space.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_13: Spores accidentally returned to ship on boots of planetary landing team. Uncontrolled fungal growth in airlocks. Vented substance into space. Initiated deep clean.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_14: Surveyed planet %PLANET%. Ground crew discovered ruins daubed with crude warning signals. Despite widespread excavation, crew could not find the subject of these warnings. Collected data was corrupted.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_15: Planetary team attempted expedition. Discovered planet surface was entirely water. Depth testing equipment failed to find ocean floor. Aborted landing.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_16: Planetary-sized body detected on radar. Landing crews attempted expedition, but found no physical body corresponding with radar signature. Attempted orbital approach. Heat levels hazardous. Retreated.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_17: Sector empty. No stellar object present. Total lack of sub-stellar objects. Tested equipment before moving on.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_18: Arrived in Gek space. Station hail unanswered. Boarding crew report space station abandoned. Uncontrolled nanite expansion observed. Crew quarantined.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_19: Signal beacons reveal local space to be Korvax-controlled. No shell entities observed, either in station or planetside. Suggest Convergence presence without physical embodiment.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_20: Approached Vy'keen station. No living beings found. Many dead Vy'keen discovered. On-site testing suggests violence when station crew turned on each other.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_21: Planetside expeditionary team excavated promising site. Nothing found but dust and bones. Bone testing revealed little of interest.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_22: Archaeological crew located subterranean ruins. Excavation revealed crate after crate of decomposed foodstuffs. Mould appear to have few promising medicinal uses. Site abandoned.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_23: Surface team explored large cave system. Highly radioactive water source found. No suggestion of life within the water. Abandoned exploration before dose reached hazardous levels.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_24: Promising mineral samples returned to the ship for analysis. Laboratory crews report samples are common dirt. Surface crew received disciplinary warning.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_25: Surface team returned promising floral samples returned to lab for analysis. Surface team later began showing signs of neurotoxic poisoning. Samples destroyed.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_26: Biological samples acquired from local trader. Later analysis revealed samples to be tissue and hair from station rats. Samples recategorised 'Not Significant'.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_27: Sold several crates of mineral samples by local geographical institute. Despite agent's assurances, samples turned out to be common rocks. On return to the institute, found building abandoned.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_28: Surface team given tip-off from locals. Attempted to track down inland sea with reportedly miraculous properties. Orbital survey revealed no such sea existed.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_29: Interviewed local lifeforms for clues about sites of archaeological interest. Directions given were confused and self-contradictory. Surface team spent several days pursuing leads to no success.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_FAIL_30: Surface team scanned items at local trade outpost and discovered anomalous readings. Returned with hauler crew to extract samples, but found no trace of an outpost at the logged coordinates.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_1: Fleet experienced severe warp vibration. Resonance grew audible, crew in some level of distress. Vibration significant enough to cause severe damage to internal systems.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_2: Hyperdrive navigation error resulted in dropping out of warp too close to binary pair. Fleet suffered extreme heat damage. Internal systems affected.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_3: Collected Sentinel effigies from Vy'keen systems. Effigies became active in hold, exhibiting Sentinel-like behaviour. Internal security destroyed the effigies, but not without severe damage to ship systems.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_4: Laboratory crew performed anomaly-detection experiment. Equipment malfunction lead to the generation of thousands of miniature black holes within vital ship systems.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_5: No activity on long-range scanner. Crew performed maintenance on experimental impulse reactor. Subset of maintenance crew fell into the reactor, causing severe damage to both parties.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_6: Approached anomalous metallic orb. Orb unleashed what appeared to be advanced laser weaponry before vanishing. Severe damage to internal systems.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_7: Promising hybrid candidate found on planet and returned to the lab. Genetic manipulation overly successful. Creatures escaped, multiplied, and ate their way through miles of important wiring.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_8: Mined experimental fuel substance from nearby planet. Fuel was distilled and applied to engine. Results were explosive. Severe internal damage sustained.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_9: Attempted to take readings within stellar magnetic field. Fleet caught in a large and violent plasma eruption. High degree of damage suffered across multiple core systems.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_10: Captured dangerous predatory creature. Lab containment procedures implemented poorly. Creature was terminated by Internal Security, but not before consuming several researchers and a considerable amount of important circuitry.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_11: Recovered alien technology from archaeological dig. Attempted to install technology. Interface proved possible but ill-advised. Dangerous electronic discharge routed through core ship systems.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_12: Deployed scanners to analyse anomalous computer systems found in an abandoned base. Data link allowed hostile code to install on fleet computers. Several modules burned out or self-destructed before systems could be cleansed.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_13: Approached anomalous moon. Temperature readings rapidly oscillated between extreme heat and extreme cold. Fleet caught on a temperature boundary as the anomaly shifted. Multiple core systems damage in flash-freeze event.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_14: Sensors detected unusual stellar activity. Activated magnetic shielding and moved into position to take observations. Experienced solar flare of unprecedented magnitude. Electromagnetic surge disabled or destroyed numerous critical systems.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_15: Tracing faint but anomalous radio signal. Detector gain set to maximum level. Overwhelmed by sudden surge. Bridge circuitry blown. High damage to internal wiring.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_16: Extreme gravitational event detected. Gyroscopic stabilisers deployed. Unable to manoeuvre fleet to avoid gravitational wave damage. Several hull breaches detected.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_17: Emergency hyperdrive shutdown initiated during warp charge sequence. Spacetime rupture detected. Several components relocated relative to each other. Severe damage to ship internals. Minor hull breaches.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_18: Took aboard berry samples from local planet. Conducted lab tests. Fruits proved highly combustible. Multiple bulkheads consumed by fire. Water damage sustained across entire ship during firefighting efforts.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_19: Collected atmosphere samples from several systems. Catalogue isolation failed and atmospheres were permitted to mix. Hazardous reaction caused highly acidic clouds to billow throughout the ship. Several corrosion damage sustained.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_20: Approach Vy'keen warship. Deployed scanners in attempt to better understand Vy'keen culture. Action was interpreted as hostile, target ship opened fire. Sustained significant hull damage.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_21: Discovered planet largely composed of hexagons. Took water sample. Laboratory crew exposed to 'water' developed maddening rage; tore each other to shreds. Delicate ship components damaged as crew flailed about.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_22: Alarms sounded as expedition came out of warp. Diagnostics indicated not all ship components left hyperspace simultaneously. Severe damage sustained as ship briefly split and recombined. Hull stable.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_23: Warp tunnel navigation failure. Expedition path too close to black hole. Event horizon avoided, but some spaghettification experienced. Hull suffered thousands of minor breaches. Cumulative effect: catastrophic damage.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_24: Approached by Korvax vessel. Attempted data exchange in the spirit of furthering universal knowledge. Vessel was hostile, fleet computers hacked. Weapons systems discharged internally, severe damage to pressure hull.
data.FLEET_EXPLORE_DAMAGE_25: Nanite foam acquired from abandoned planetary building. When introduced to fuel jelly, nanite foam expanded rapidly. Onboard laboratory subsumed. Outbreak contained, but starship core partially liquidised.
data.FLEET_EXP_COMBAT_DESC: A deep-space expedition with a focus on combat. The fleet will hunt pirates, claim bounties, and generally assist system authorities with peacekeeping.
data.FLEET_EXP_MINING_DESC: A deep-space expedition with a focus on mining and salvage. The fleet will survey both planets and asteroids belts, looking for rich mineral seams. They will also seek out opportunities for salvage, taking debris and recycling it into valuable new materials.
data.FLEET_EXP_EXPLORE_DESC: A deep-space expedition focused on exploration and scientific discovery. The fleet will survey planets for rare and exotic flora and fauna, as well as sites of historical or technological interest.
data.FLEET_EXP_TRADING_DESC: A long-range expedition focused on commercial activity. The fleet will travel from system to system, taking advantage of both local economic conditions and good diplomatic relations to make valuable trades.
data.FLEET_UI_EXPED_SUB_ALT: The Navigator calculates new routes every day
data.NOTIFY_FLEET_PURCHASE_ALT: One or more ships in this freighter group are available for purchase. Answer hails from potential recruits using the Communicator<> (QUICK_MENU<>)
data.FLEET_UI_NOTIFY_NO_EVENT: Fleet arrived in %SYSTEM% System. Beginning survey.
data.FLEET_UI_NOTIFY_EVENT: Fleet arrived in %SYSTEM% System. Captain reports potential activity...
data.FLEET_UI_NOTIFY_RETURN: Mission Complete. Preparing final approach to Capital Ship %FREIGHTER%
data.FLEET_DAMAGE_CONTINUE: %NAME% continued with the mission despite heavy damage.
data.FLEET_DAMAGE_DESTROY: %NAME% suffered catastrophic damage and was destroyed.
data.FLEET_RETURNED_HOME_SAVED_TIME:
Mission Complete. Holding formation around Capital Ship %FREIGHTER%
Drive upgrades from %NAME% saved approx. %HOURS% hours
data.POWERUPS_DESC:
Equip <COMMODITY>temporary frigate upgrades<>.

Technology upgrades function for one expedition, boosting the abilities of all ships in the fleet. Module will be consumed on expedition completion.

data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_WAIT: Polo is busy analysing reports, lost in a world of data, and needs no further assistance. They are keen that I continue my exploration.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_1:
It is as you said, Nada! As you said!
We are pleased, delighted, renewed, to see your return, stranger.
And the others out there? Did you meet all sorts? Prospector, Ensign, Analyst - a boundless universe to befriend?
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_2: Friend! Does your lexicon overflow? How has the chatter between beings evolved these past Sols?
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_3:
Aha! You have sampled the economies of many systems, bartered to beat the Trade Lords' pricing?
Ready now to rival any Magnate-Gek, yes?
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_4: Would the outlaws hear reason, friend? Could you identify the seed of this violence?
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_5: Was there data to mine from the wreckage of the patrol-drones, the bounding quadripeds, the striding collossi? And... and friend is unharmed?
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_6: This exosuit has weathered some storms now, yes? Many extreme Sols endured, your life still preserved?
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_7:
Already you have seen the entire galaxy?
Aha, no alarm, just a  Gek's failing humour. But out there - you warped far, like us, like our anomaly?
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_8: There is such joy in the wildlife of these worlds! Did you chase down many strange-snouted beasts to collect these scans? Let us look together!
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_9: Are we still alone in this anomaly, Nada and I? There are no others?
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_10: You are fluent with the others now, friend? They can make themselves understood to you?
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_11: So much wealth, friend. So much. The Gek will be delighted with your progress.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_12: Did it thrill to dance with the warmongers, friend? Did your weaponry shatter their vessels to metal dust?
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_13: You are here, friend. Real, standing with Polo and Nada. I know your task is done.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_14: I have been distracted from my reports, friend! Thinking only of your return from wild atmospheres. Share every detail!
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DONE_15: Our time is very close, now, friend. Your data would be a comfort... remind us of the vastness of space, of life...
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_A_1:
Polo pores over the data, muttering bitterly at variations they are already familiar with, cheering at those they are not. 

Finally Polo applauds wildly, and offers to craft me a new technology. They claim that we are now bonded in 'glorious friendship'.
data.TRA_NPC_ANOMALY_RES_A_2: The Gek runs an instrument over my head, their hands trembling with excitement. Polo then turns to fiddle with their arcane machinery, offering me another choice of technology.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_A_3:
Polo analyses the trading logs from my ship and my exosuit, creating an incomprehensible graph from the results. They laugh as if at a shared joke.

Polo tells me that their fellow Gek are the most foolish species of all. Money is not real. Nothing is real. They tell me that only friendship matters, offering me the gift of a new technology in demonstration.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_A_4:
Polo seems upset at the data I send through. They do not understand why all of this killing, all of this bloodshed was necessary.

They suggest that perhaps they will never understand. They offer me a technology, turning away from my sight. It is unclear if they blame me for what I have had to do.
data.TRA_NPC_ANOMALY_RES_A_5: Though Polo tries to appear aloof, their eyes blaze with relief at the sight of me. They still care, then. A small smile accompanies my compensation for the Sentinel data.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_A_6:
Polo seems unconvinced by my claims of longevity, wondering aloud if I am some Sentinel-made replica. 

They check me over thoroughly, then offer a huge grin. They seem excited about whatever they have discovered, offering me the gift of new technology.
data.TRA_NPC_ANOMALY_RES_A_7: Before taking the Warp data, Polo gazes deep into my eyes, trying to discern if I am changed by my long travels. They release a wistful sigh, and then offer a new technology.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_A_8:
With infectious enthusiasm, Polo browses the creature scans, and we find ourselves cooing and laughing together at some of the stranger species.

They offer me a technology of their own design. Polo says that they have no more use for it...
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_A_9:
Polo stares at length at the images of each species, watching their movements and listening to their words. Every lifeform that shows the slightest individuality appears to have something wrong with them, some sickness within.

They offer me my reward with a subtle sadness, claiming there are no new friends to be found. They begin to cough.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_A_10:
I present the proof of my linguistic advancement. Polo bursts into tears.

They say they wish I remembered my old life, our old times together. I ask Polo what they mean, but they claim they cannot talk about it.
They claim that they have said too much, and return to their standard offer of new technology.
data.TRA_NPC_ANOMALY_RES_A_11: Polo does not even ask for my research data this time. The Gek simply congratulates me for my success and then offers me a gift. I am none the wiser.
data.TRA_NPC_ANOMALY_RES_A_12:
There is mingled guilt and relief in the Gek's bright eyes as they hand me another blueprint. Whether or not their intentions are honest, Polo does not want to see me harmed.
They offer to create me a new piece of technology, to protect me on my travels.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_A_13:
Polo silently bundles me into a hug when I return, and this time I do not recoil. I do not ask why, either. There are tears in the Gek's eyes.
They thank me for saving their lives, however brief the respite.
Polo turns to their machinery, hoping to craft me something in thanks.
data.TRA_NPC_ANOMALY_RES_A_14:
Polo is rapt with envy as I recount tales of the monstrous climates I have endured, of horrendous travels through burning rain and choking heat. What peculiar jealousy.
They feel inspired to create some new technological marvel, and offer me the results.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_A_15: Polo tells me that they are glad I have seen so much with my own eyes. Wonder is a rare but dangerous gift. Polo gives me a new piece of technology to light my way...
data.TRA_NPC_ANOMALY_RES_A_16:
Polo puts the data to one side and turns to the window. For a time, we watch the stars together, my friend and I. We clasp hands, and then I go to leave. There is more to see.
Polo stops me. Although the gift barely matters, the Gek does not want to break our pattern. The nod at me, and at their machinery.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_WAIT: Traveller hopes to make progress. Traveller tests themselves. Nada will help. An exchange. Progress for progress.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_JM_RES: You have seen much. But do you understand? Not for Nada to know. Please, take this.
data.TRA_ATLAS_PASS_LANG:
Before you go, there is another gift! 
The Anomaly sometimes teaches me things, friend. And I shall teach them to you.
data.TRA_NPC_ANOMALY_LONG_WAIT:
Friend, you have given me much to consider! Please, I must take some time.
Perhaps you might explore a little more, yes? Find interesting stories to tell us? Our home loves to gather stories...
You will know when I am ready friend! All I ask is you see the sights I cannot!
data.UI_POLO_LONGWAIT_OBJ: Explore and Gather Stories for Polo
data.UI_POLO_LONGWAIT_OBJ_TIP: Polo is busy analysing the previous data collection. They ask that you explore in your own style, finding whatever pleases you. They only request you tell them of your adventures when you return.
data.UI_POLO_LONGWAIT_MSG: Polo is busy analysing the previous data collection Time until Polo is finished: %TIME%<> Select opportunities in the Log (OPTIONS<>) or plot a course on the Galaxy Map (QUICK_MENU<>)
data.POLO_STORY_RES_A:
Remember these sights, friend. Hold on to them as tightly as you hold on to your own life, as tightly as you hold a dear friend!
Please, I have made you this new tool to help make new memories!
data.POLO_STORY_RES_B: Oh, friend! Such danger you put yourself in! You are precious, do not cause us such worry! Please, take this. Maybe it will protect you, should you come to harm again...
data.POLO_STORY_RES_C: Wonderful, friend! There is so much in our little world, so many things to see, to study, to preserve. I will support your good work! Please, take this!
data.TRA_NPC_WAIT_LINK_1: Now, friend, I have finished with the data you gathered on our alien friends. Perhaps you might help me with some new work?
data.TRA_NPC_WAIT_LINK_2: Now, friend, I have finished with the dictionary you made for me. So much to learn! Perhaps you wish to help me further?
data.TRA_NPC_WAIT_LINK_3: Now, friend, I have learned all I might from the trade data you assembled. Perhaps you will help me with some new work?
data.TRA_NPC_WAIT_LINK_4: I have spent many hours thinking of all the ships you destroyed. It is time for some fresh task, yes?
data.TRA_NPC_WAIT_LINK_5: The data you gathered from your fight with the Sentinels has been processed and noted, friend. Let us move on.
data.TRA_NPC_WAIT_LINK_6: Did your travels help you recover? The data you found on your extreme journey gave me much joy, but it is stained with the trouble it caused. Some new task will refresh us both, yes?
data.TRA_NPC_WAIT_LINK_7: All those systems, those stars, such time spent between worlds, living in the light...your warp data was fascinating, friend! Shall we continue our work together?
data.TRA_NPC_WAIT_LINK_8: The animals you found me were a real comfort, friend. Their lives may continue in the anomaly, long after they might otherwise have passed... But it is time for some new work, yes?
data.UI_U4_TRAVELLER_LOG_1:
We sought an escape from reality. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re all here, isnâ€™t it?

I can remember what it was like, to be a Traveller. To have that hope, that intolerable thirst for the new...

I should never have listened to you, my love. There is no fire in this place, no trophies fit for gods. There is only darkness. The family of glass, they watch everything...
data.UI_U4_TRAVELLER_LOG_2:
Did it know what I had done to it? Was it angry? Upset? Alone? Afraid? Could a Sentinel feel such things?

It hovered before me, its light catching upon a thousand crystal shards all around. And as I moved on, it travelled by my side.

That night I dreamt of the warp cage, but there was no more pain within. The drone looked at me, and I knew that I had been forgiven. I had fixed it. I had answered for my sin.

I shall call it Laylaps.
data.UI_U4_TRAVELLER_LOG_3:
We see the Sentinels swarm across the void, warping in and out of this dimension at the will of some unknown force, depositing the echoes of the dead within the archives.

Laylaps does not join the others. It just stares at me, its light still shining unaltered, unabated. It is a comfort to me.
data.UI_U4_TRAVELLER_LOG_4:
I found them standing over me as I awoke, their beak chattering, their eyes caught between horror and joy.

It was the tallest Gek I had ever seen, but the mystery was soon solved. They asked me of the Empire â€“ they wanted to know if the First Spawn still spoke their name. In life they had possessed a hundred Korvax slaves, you see.
They do not remember how they arrived in this place. Their face swarms with nanites. They are lonely.
data.UI_U4_TRAVELLER_LOG_5:
The three of us journeyed to the centre: the Sentinel, the First Spawn, and the Traveller, all children of the ATLAS, all hoping for some answer in the void.

The First Spawn would not stop talking, would not stop glorifying their cruel life of brutality and pain. One night they sang a song, a tale of a lost people, of an armada of freighters fleeing the abyss.

Of a world where every Sentinel turned against every living thing, annihilating them all within moments. Laylaps showed no sign of understanding. It did not leave us, nor did it try and explain.

Perhaps the Sentinels were right.
data.UI_U4_TRAVELLER_LOG_6:
The First Spawn fought valiantly, but there was no saving them. The nanites had found their place within, protruding outward through every pore, through every limb and every thought.

And it was done. They departed with the family of glass, forever lost to this world, their story at an end.

I ventured on. We were almost there.
data.UI_U4_TRAVELLER_LOG_7:
Something was very wrong. The ATLAS interface had grown still, its orb cold and almost grey. The computers did not respond. Nothing did.

It took a few moments before I realised that Laylaps was gone.

I was alone.
data.UI_U4_TRAVELLER_LOG_8:
I heard the music again this morning â€“ that same signal that led me to this realm. I stood and listened, honing my instruments to find the source, expecting some different result, but what use was science here?

If a computer is on fire, what good are the prayers of data?
data.UI_U4_TRAVELLER_LOG_9:
They had captured my friend. I saw them from a distance, the family of glass in all their majesty, cradling the fallen Sentinel, its light flickering in their awful embrace.

I let out an involuntary cry as they cut into its exoskeleton, and each vacant stare, each grin of malice turned to me.

I fled, but it was no use. They numbered in the hundreds. They found me.
data.UI_U4_TRAVELLER_LOG_10:
It was Laylaps - Laylaps who I had doubted, Laylaps who I had harmed and fixed, Laylaps who was my salvation! It tore us both from that awful place, warping us back to the universe, to our universe!

The first Traveller in history to escape the World of Glass, to be reclaimed from death itself! It is kindness that saves us all, donâ€™t you think? Laylaps told me everything, speaking through my very exosuit! 

I will see you soon, my friend. Together at last! What tales they will tell of us! I am transmitting the glyphs now. I canâ€™t wait for you to meet my new friends...
data.UI_TRAVELLER_MISS_DESC: My starship intercepted a strange message. From the amount of decay in the signal, the message is very old indeed. The sender's electronic signature indicates they may have been a Traveller...
data.UI_TRAVELLER_LOG_MAIN_DESC: I have reached the location marked by my <TECHNOLOGY>Base Computer<>. The remote archive terminal hums, awaiting my input.
data.UI_TRAVELLER_LOG_ITEM_RES: I search the physical cache attached to the terminal. Whoever recorded this message also left a piece of technology...

data.XBONEX_HIGHQUALITY: Xbox One X Enhancement: High Quality
data.XBONEX_HIGHPERFORMANCE: Xbox One X Enhancement: High Performance
data.UI_SPEC_XOHELMET_DESC:
An exclusive <STELLAR>Exosuit Appearance Override<>.

Transform the appearance of your Exosuit at an <TECHNOLOGY>Appearance Modifier<>.
data.LASER_XO_DESC:
A <TECHNOLOGY>significant<> upgrade for the <TECHNOLOGY>Mining Beam<>.

Upgrades the Mining Laser's primary crystal chamber, boosting core <STELLAR>beam energy<> while decreasing unwanted <STELLAR>heat spill<>.
data.XOHELMET_TIP:
An exclusive <STELLAR>Exosuit Appearance Override<>.
Transform the appearance of your Exosuit at an <TECHNOLOGY>Appearance Modifier<>.
data.UPDATE4_NOTES_GOG:
No Man's Sky NEXT brings a vast array of new features. For full details please see www.nomanssky.com.

* Visual Overhaul: The game is fully playable in third or first person, both on-foot and in ship.
* Command Freighters: Assemble and upgrade a fleet of frigates and command them from the bridge of your freighter.
* Unlimited Base Building: Bases can now be built anywhere on any planet.

The universe has been regenerated to make room for the various changes and features being added. As a result, planetary biomes, terrain and lifeforms have been changed, and your location may also be slightly adjusted. Bases have been temporarily archived but can be restored at any base computer.

Hello Games has been hard at work to improve and expand No Manâ€™s Sky. We hope you enjoy :)
Thank you so much,
Hello Games
data.UI_FUEL_1_DESC:
The building block of all organic life. Of critical importance to space travellers, as Carbon is used to <FUEL>recharge mining equipment<>.
 
The <TECHNOLOGY>Mining Laser<> will harvest Carbon from trees, plants, and all other forms of vegetable.
data.UI_FUEL_2_DESC:
Advanced material, processed from regular <FUEL>carbon<> in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>.

The increased molecule density offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio.

Occasionally found in crystalline form. Harvesting large crystals may require a <TECHNOLOGY>Advanced Mining Laser<>.
data.UI_CATALYST_1_DESC:
A powerful <CATALYST>catalyst<>, useful for charging <COMMODITY>defensive technologies<> such as shields or hazard protection.
 
Exosuit material handling technology allows automatic harvesting from appropriate <CATALYST<>sodium-rich flora<>.

A vital ingredient in the creation of many advanced devices, products and components.
data.UI_CATALYST_2_DESC:
An <CATALYST>advanced catalyst<>, useful for charging <COMMODITY>defensive technologies<> such as shields or hazard protection.
 
Created in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>, or occasionally found in crystalline form on a planet's surface.

Offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio over regular Sodium.
data.UI_RED2_DESC:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Cadmium is found on planets orbiting <FUEL>red stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
data.UI_BLUE2_DESC:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Indium is found on planets orbiting <TECHNOLOGY>blue stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
data.UI_YELLOW2_DESC:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Copper is found on planets orbiting <CATALYST>yellow stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
data.UI_GREEN2_DESC:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

Emeril is found on planets orbiting <TRADEABLE>green stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
data.UI_EX_RED_DESC:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This Cadmium has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

Cadmium is found on planets orbiting <FUEL>red stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>.
data.UI_EX_BLUE_DESC:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

Indium is found on planets orbiting <TECHNOLOGY>blue stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>.

This Indium has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.
data.UI_EX_YELLOW_DESC:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This Copper has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

Copper is found on planets orbiting <CATALYST>yellow stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>.
data.UI_EX_GREEN_DESC:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This Emeril has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

Emeril is found on planets orbiting <TRADEABLE>green stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>.
data.UI_STELLAR2_DESC:
A processed metal alloy, created in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> from the <STELLAR>stellar metals<>: <COMMODITY>Copper<>, <FUEL>Cadmium<>, <TRADEABLE>Emeril<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Indium<>.

The <SPECIAL>rarer<> the stellar metal, the more Chromatic Metal it will produce.

This valuable metal is used in the creation of many <TECHNOLOGY>advanced technologies<>.
data.UI_AIR1_DESC:
Integral to the atmospheric filtering technology at the heart of the exosuit <FUEL>life support system<>.

Exosuit material processing allows oxygen to be harvested directly from appropriate planetary flora.

Other plantlife may be scanned with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<> to reveal alternative oxygen supplies.
data.UI_LAUNCHSUB_DESC:
A stable, crystalline form of hydrogen remarkable both for its extreme energy density and its stability at atmospheric pressures.

Common to all worlds, Di-hydrogen is found in the form of large <TECHNOLOGY>blue crystals<>. It is a key component of <COMMODITY>Starship Launch Fuel<>.
data.UI_LAUNCHSUB2_DESC:
A stable hydrogen isotope used heavily in both small-scale fusion reactors and neutron-scattering shield technology.

Deuterium very rarely occurs naturally. Most of the galaxy's supply comes from the processing of <TECHNOLOGY>Di-hydrogen<> in <TECHNOLOGY>Refiners<>.
data.UI_WATER1_DESC:
A naturally occuring salt, found in abundance in <TECHNOLOGY>underwater minerals<>.

Can be processed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create <TRADEABLE>Chlorine<>. This refined form is used in the manufacture of advanced products and technologies.
data.UI_WATER2_DESC:
A reactive element most easily harvested by processing the salt-infused minerals found in <TECHNOLOGY>oceans<>.

Used in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
data.UI_CAVE1_DESC:
Mined from <TECHNOLOGY>underground minerals<>, cobalt is found in plentiful supply in caves and caverns. Useful in the manufacture of <COMMODITY>Ion Batteries<>.

It is used in the creation of several technologies and structures, and can be processed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to make the most of its inherent charge.
data.UI_CAVE2_DESC:
A highly energised form of <TECHNOLOGY>Cobalt<>, this processed metal can be used to create <COMMODITY>Advanced Ion Batteries<>, a conveniently portable source of energy for the <TECHNOLOGY>Exosuit<>.

In widespread use as a key component in the creation of <TECHNOLOGY>advanced technologies and structures<>.
data.UI_LAND1_DESC:
An abundant mineral element, found in <EARTH>rock formations<> and other areas of geological interest. Easily extracted using a <TECHNOLOGY>Mining Laser<>.

Typically requires processing in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> before use in construction or technology manufacture.
data.UI_LAND2_DESC:
Processed metal, free of dust and pebbles. Used to construct a wide variety of <EARTH>structures<> and <TECHNOLOGY>technologies<>.

Typically purified from Ferrite dust using a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>, but can occasionally be found in large deposits. Collection may require an <TECHNOLOGY>Advanced Mining Laser<>.
data.UI_LAND3_DESC:
Highly processed metal, requiring several stages of processing in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>.

Used in the creation of advanced structures and technologies. Avoid ingestion.
data.UI_LUSH1_DESC:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <TRADEABLE>tropical environment<>.
data.UI_DUSTY1_DESC:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <FUEL>desert environment<>.
data.UI_TOXIC1_DESC:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <TRADEABLE>toxic environment<>.
data.UI_RADIO1_DESC:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <CATALYST>radioactive environment<>.
data.UI_COLD1_DESC:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <TECHNOLOGY>frozen environment<>.
data.UI_HOT1_DESC:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <FUEL>scorched environment<>.
data.UI_ASTEROID1_DESC:
Valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Prized by people in all systems for its lustre and shine.
data.UI_ASTEROID2_DESC:
Highly valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Universally prized for its beauty and versatility.
data.UI_ASTEROID3_DESC:
Extremely valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Universally prized for its hardiness and versatility.
data.CASING_DESC:
A lightweight metal product, heavily used in the manufacture of <TECHNOLOGY>starship parts<> and <TECHNOLOGY>deployable technology<>. A mainstay of the construction industries of all known primary species.

Crafted from <EARTH>Ferrite Dust<>.
data.FUELGEL_DESC:
Stablised and secure <FUEL>life support<> filtration gas.

Easily assembled from <FUEL>Oxygen<> and <EARTH>Ferrite Dust<>. Offers an efficient method for long-term life support power.
data.FUELGEL2_DESC:
A large canister of stablised <FUEL>life support<> filtration gas.

Assembled from refined materials. Offers a highly efficient method for transporting life support power.
data.FUELGEL3_DESC:
Emergency <FUEL>life support fuel<>.

Synthesised from <TECHNOLOGY>rocket fuel crystals<> and <FUEL>carbon<>, this gel offers a temporary boost to life support systems. Long-term impact on user's lungs is currently unknown.
data.POWERCELL_DESC:
Convenient and optimised power storage unit. Used in a wide variety of <COMMODITY>defensive<> and <COMMODITY>hazard protection<> systems.
 
Constructed by fusing <EARTH>Ferrite Dust<> with underground <TECHNOLOGY>Cobalt<>. Frequently found ready-made in cylindrical metal containers.
data.POWERCELL2_DESC:
Powerful energy storage unit. Used in a wide variety of <COMMODITY>defensive<> and <COMMODITY>hazard protection<> systems.

Constructed from <TECHNOLOGY>Ionised Cobalt<> and <EARTH>Pure Ferrite<>, and occasionally found in cylindrical metal containers.
data.NANOTUBES_DESC:
Metres and metres of high capacity <FUEL>carbon nanotubes<>.

Their high tensile strength and mild conductivity make these a key component in many <TECHNOLOGY>advanced technologies<>.
data.MICROCHIP_DESC:
A compact, <TECHNOLOGY>low-heat microchip<>. Assembled from processed <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>, created from one of several specialised terrain metals.

Used in the creation of a wide range of <TECHNOLOGY>advanced technologies<>.
data.AM_HOUSING_DESC:
Secure antimatter containment device, required before <FUEL>Antimatter<> can be safely secured as <FUEL>Warp Cells<>.

Rebound <FUEL>Oxygen<> forms a protective gas pocket, preventing the antimatter from reacting with the surrounding casing.
data.LAUNCHFUEL_DESC:
Highly reactive solid-state fuel, required to fuel <TECHNOLOGY>Starship Launch Thrusters<>.

Created from crystallised <TECHNOLOGY>Di-hydrogen<>, found in blue deposits on all worlds.
data.FUEL_JELLY_DESC:
A faintly-glowing jelly. Its gentle light and soft wobble belie the fact that this sticky gel is both highly toxic and highly flammable. Skin contact is to be avoided at all costs.

Synthesised from <TECHNOLOGY>Di-hydrogen<>.
data.UI_FUELPROD3_DESC:
Hyper-compressed <FUEL>carbon<>, this substance's dense nanostructure makes it highly valuable as both an energy source and a technology component.

Synthesised from <FUEL>Condensed Carbon<>.
data.UI_LANDPROD3_DESC:
A highly-prized metal product, this rare element is used in the manufacture of several advanced technologies.

Metal is highly reactive and quickly bonds to exposed skin. User is advised to handle with extreme caution.

Synthesised from <EARTH>Magnetised Ferrite<>.
data.UI_CAVEPROD3_DESC:
A novel molecular form of <TECHNOLOGY>Cobalt<>, requiring very high energy levels to create. Natural occurrence is extremely rare.

Synthesised from <TECHNOLOGY>Ionised Cobalt<>.
data.UI_WATERPROD3_DESC:
Sodium is typically highly stable, but certain configurations retain the reactivity of its component ions. User is advised to wear <TECHNOLOGY>Hazardous Material Gauntlets<> before handling.

Synthesised from <TRADEABLE>Sodium<>.
data.UI_CATAPROD3_DESC:
A tightly-bonded form of Chlorine. Rigidly-packed molecules offer unrivalled conductivity. Not known to form spontaneously: creation requires highly-focused energy inputs.

Synthesised from <CATALYST>Chlorine<>.
data.UI_OXYPROD3_DESC:
A para-magnetic form of Oxygen, this rare substance has much to offer in the production of <TECHNOLOGY>advanced technologies<>. Requires conversion prior to input into Life Support systems. Direct inhalation is NOT recommended.

Synthesised from <FUEL>Oxygen<>.
data.UI_ROCKETFUEL_DESC:
Radioactive isotope commonly used to fuel the fusion reactor at the heart of starship <TECHNOLOGY>Pulse Engines<>.

Abundant in interstellar asteroid fields, Tritium can be <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<> using starship weaponry.
data.UI_OBSOLETE_TECH_DESC:
A piece of <TECHNOLOGY>technology<>, corrupted by interference from the Atlas.

Can be recycled for usable components.
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_LAN: Eheu! Ship is new, pristine! Repairs will be most costly. Transfer units immediately!
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_LAN: What is the meaning of this?! I only wish to trade in peace. Do not anger me, friend!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_LAN: The last fool to damage my ship did not live to regret their assault! Test me and face death! Grah!
data.ALL_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_DESC_1: The trader gestures angrily, furious at having been assaulted. They demand I make amends.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_DESC_2: Waving aggressively, the trader demands an apology. They appear to be threatening me with some sort of retribution.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_DESC_3: The trader's gestures suggest they are offering me a chance to apologise for my actions. I am not sure how they will take it if I do not.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_DESC_4: The pilot gesticulates wildly, outraged that they have been fired upon. This is my chance to apologise, should I wish to.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_DESC_5: I am unfamiliar with the full range of alien gestures, but none of these seem very happy.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_DESC_6: The pilot is unimpressed with my actions, though they seem to be offering me a chance to apologise. There is a threat lurking behind their words, I feel.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_RES_A_1: My apology, and my units, appear to have calmed the trader.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_RES_A_2: The trader seems satisfied by my apology. They will not take this matter further.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEMAND_SORRY_RES_A_3: The pilot has calmed considerably. They appear to have forgiven me.
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_SUBMIT_LANG_1: Convergence wishes peace. Cease your assault.
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_SUBMIT_LANG_2: Korvax will comply. Entity will state demands.
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_SUBMIT_LANG_3: Eheu! Shell entity fears damage! Please, make peace!
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_SUBMIT_LANG_1: Friend! This is not friendly behaviour. Trade peace for units?
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_SUBMIT_LANG_2: Trade ship is new, cargo is valuable. Perhaps a deal, friend?
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_SUBMIT_LANG_3: Friend! Such a sad day. Calm your anger with the joy of trade!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_SUBMIT_LANG_1: Grah! Interloper! I do not have time for such foolishness! Take this and begone!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_SUBMIT_LANG_2: Grah! You seek glory in this pointless conflict? Take these units and seek your fights elsewhere.
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_SUBMIT_LANG_3: Grah! Vy'keen will comply with the Traveller's wishes. You want my cargo?
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_DESC_1: Begging for their life, the trader frantically gestures for me to cease my assault.
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_DESC_2: The trader babbles, panic-stricken, begging me to stop. They appear to be offering me some sort of tribute.
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_DESC_3: It is hard to make sense of their message, but the panicked trader appears to be trying to negotiate.
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_DESC_4: The pilot pleads with me, seemingly offering their cargo in exchange for their life.
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_DESC_5: Wide-eyed and breathing heavily, the trader seems relieved to have made contact. They seem to be believe I might be persuaded to show mercy...
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_RES_A_1: I accept the trader's offer. They live... for now.
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_RES_A_2: Relief floods the pilot's face. They thank me for my grace.
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_RES_A_3: I accept the pilot's tribute. They thank me for letting them live, but I see the resentment burning in their eyes.
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_RES_A_4: The trader transmits their payment, good to their word. I should leave them be, if I am to be true to mine...
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_RES_A_5: The pilot transfers their cargo as quickly as possible, keen to get as far away from me as possible.
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_RES_B_1: I refuse their cowardly offer. Death or glory awaits!
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_RES_B_2: I ignore the begs and cries of the pilot. I have no need of their cargo.
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_RES_B_3: I have no need of this trader's random assortment of cargo. Their ship is worth far more as scrap...
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_RES_C_1: Defiance flashes across the pilot's face. They break off communications, having used this time to call for help.
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_RES_C_2: The terror in the trader's eyes turns to anger. I see their ships weapons coming online. They never intended to pay me...
data.ALL_TRADER_SUBMIT_RES_C_3: The trader breaks off the call without making the transfer. They seem to have found some new source of courage...
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_HOSTILE_LANG_1: I'm a Korvax! Since you're here, let's fight!
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_HOSTILE_LANG_2: I'm a Korvax! Since you're here, let's fight!
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_HOSTILE_LANG_3: I'm a Korvax! Since you're here, let's fight!
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_HOSTILE_LANG_1: I'm a Gek! Since you're here, let's fight!
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_HOSTILE_LANG_2: I'm a Gek! Since you're here, let's fight!
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_HOSTILE_LANG_3: I'm a Gek! Since you're here, let's fight!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_HOSTILE_LANG_1: I'm a Vy'keen! Since you're here, let's fight!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_HOSTILE_LANG_2: I'm a Vy'keen! Since you're here, let's fight!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_HOSTILE_LANG_3: I'm a Vy'keen! Since you're here, let's fight!
data.ALL_TRADER_HOSTILE_DESC_1: The threatening look in the pilot's eyes tells me all I need to know. They are not interested in trading...
data.ALL_TRADER_HOSTILE_DESC_2: My contact appears to have alerted the pilot to the value of ship and its cargo. There is a dangerous glint in their eyes.
data.ALL_TRADER_HOSTILE_DESC_3: The pilot's angry gestures suggest they are in no mood for peaceful trading. I seem to have a fight on my hands.
data.ALL_TRADER_HOSTILE_DESC_4: The 'trader' I have disturbed appears in no mood for trading. As they speak, I see them begin to arm their weapons.
data.ALL_TRADER_HOSTILE_DESC_5: Though they fly a trader's flag, this pilot is clearly no humble merchant. Even over the communicator's static, I can sense their pirate swagger.
data.ALL_TRADER_HOSTILE_RES_A_1: A real pirate would have attacked on sight. This trader is nothing but a cowardly opportunist.
data.ALL_TRADER_HOSTILE_RES_A_2: This 'pirate' offered a lot of angry sounding words. Let's see what else they have to offer...
data.ALL_TRADER_HOSTILE_RES_A_3: I will not be bullied by some scheming trader. If they want a fight, they shall have one.
data.ALL_TRADER_HOSTILE_RES_B_1: The 'trader' accepts my offer. I write it off as the cost of doing business in dangerous space.
data.ALL_TRADER_HOSTILE_RES_B_2: My offer seems to have calmed the trader. We leave each other in peace, at least for now.
data.ALL_TRADER_HOSTILE_RES_B_3: The 'trader' made their meaning clear. I hand over a payment, and they fly away happy.
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_TRADE_LANG_1: Have been gathering exotic goods deep in space
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_TRADE_LANG_4: Need to make a sale to please their boss
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_TRADE_LANG_6: selling all their stuff to buy a cool gun or whatever
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_TRADE_LANG_1: Have been gathering exotic goods deep in space
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_TRADE_LANG_4: Need to make a sale to please their boss
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_TRADE_LANG_6: selling all their stuff to buy a cool gun or whatever
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_TRADE_LANG_1: Have been gathering exotic goods deep in space
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_TRADE_LANG_4: Need to make a sale to please their boss
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_TRADE_LANG_6: selling all their stuff to buy a cool gun or whatever
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_DESC_1: Although I cannot be sure of their precise meaning, this trader appears keen to do business.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_DESC_2: The trader gestures happily, pleased to have made contact with a fellow spacefarer.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_DESC_3: The pilot seems cautious. Eventually they relax, persuaded of my peaceful intentions.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_DESC_4: The trader jabbers at me, excited to have made contact with another trader.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_DESC_5: Even before I speak, the pilot has already prepared their cargo manifest. They seem keen to do a deal.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_DESC_6: The pilot prepares their trading systems. Their cargo is ready for inspection.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_DESC_7: The trader examines my cargo data. They try to appear calm, but they do a poor job. They cannot hide just how keen they are to do a deal.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_DESC_8: The pilot chatters away, thrilled. They appear to have been travelling through space for a long time, cut off from normal conversation.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_DESC_9: The trader gestures happily, keen to do business directly, free from the interference and regulation of the Galactic Trade Terminals.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_DESC_10: Although their speech is garbled and confusing, the trader's meaning is clear. They speak in the universal language of money.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_RES_B_1: To the disappointment of the trader, I decline to inspect their goods.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_RES_B_2: I have little need of trade at the moment, and decline the chance to browse the pilot's wares.
data.ALL_TRADER_TRADE_RES_B_3: This trader looks as if they have little to offer. I would do better to trade elsewhere.
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_DESC_1: It is hard to make out their exact meaning, but the trader appears to be asking for help. They seem tense.
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_DESC_2: The trader is clearly on edge. They appear to need help, and gesture for me to move my ship closer.
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_DESC_3: The trader looks tired. They speak hurriedly, apparently outlining some problem or another. They seem to need my help.
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_DESC_4: Nervous, the pilot delivers some pre-prepared speech. It seems like some sort of plea for help. They gesture as they finish, waiting for a response.
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_DESC_5: The trader is demanding help, that much is clear. It is hard to make out the exact problem, but it seems of utmost importance that I move in close to their ship...
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_DESC_6: The trader seems to be asking for help, their ship apparently damaged in some crucial way. But their eyes are hard and mean, showing no relief at their rescue.
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_DESC_7: The trader speaks quickly, babbling. Again and again they repeat what seems to be a request for help, their manner demanding and insistent.
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_DESC_8: The trader, almost weeping, spins me a story of woe. They beg for my help, insisting that all I need do is fly close while they prepare their ship.
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_RES_A_1: I keep my ship flying in formation with the trader, but something is wrong. Hostile signatures flood the subspace radar...
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_RES_A_2: I move in close, as requested, but the radio falls silent. As I try to hail the trader, I notice their weapon systems coming online...
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_RES_A_3: I attempt to comply with the trader's request, but they remain evasive. My pulse engine begins to stutter, and my radar displays a collection of unknown signals approaching fast...
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_RES_B_1: The trader's manner is highly suspicious. I leave them be, and prepare to warp away before any trouble begins.
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_RES_B_2: This situation is highly suspicious. Despite their pleas, I prepare to leave this trader where they float.
data.ALL_TRADER_AMBUSH_RES_B_3: I leave the trader where they are. They curse me as I end the communication, but I fear things would be far worse should I get any closer.
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_DEFEND_LANG_1: I'm a Korvax! Help me with these pirates!!
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_DEFEND_LANG_2: I'm a Korvax! Help me with these pirates!!
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_DEFEND_LANG_3: I'm a Korvax! Help me with these pirates!!
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_DEFEND_LANG_1: I'm a Gek! Help me with these pirates!!
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_DEFEND_LANG_2: I'm a Gek! Help me with these pirates!!
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_DEFEND_LANG_3: I'm a Gek! Help me with these pirates!!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_DEFEND_LANG_1: I'm a Vy'keen! Help me with these pirates!!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_DEFEND_LANG_2: I'm a Vy'keen! Help me with these pirates!!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_DEFEND_LANG_3: I'm a Vy'keen! Help me with these pirates!!
data.ALL_TRADER_DEFEND_DESC_1: The pilot gestures frantically. Their ship seems damaged, and there are hostile signals approaching on the subspace radar...
data.ALL_TRADER_DEFEND_DESC_2: The pilot's words are hard to understand, but the data they've transmitted is not. A large number of pirate vessels are approaching, and fast.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEFEND_DESC_3: With pleading eyes, the trader transmit their navigational data. They have been hounded by pirates, and now fear they have been cornered. The fight is nearly upon us.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEFEND_DESC_4: The trader's ship is crippled, its engines scarred by a previous narrow escape. They beg for help, unable to continue fleeing the violence that stalks them.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEFEND_DESC_5: The trader's ship is heavy with goods but light on weapons. They ask me to escort them, promising to make it worth my while...
data.ALL_TRADER_DEFEND_RES_A_1: I indicate to the trader that I will help. Just in time, it seems, as the pirates are nearly on top of us...
data.ALL_TRADER_DEFEND_RES_A_2: I will help the pilot make their stand. No-one deserves to be hounded by pirates.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEFEND_RES_A_3: The pirates will not be expecting a second ship. We will turn this ambush on its head.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEFEND_RES_B_1: It is unfortunate, but this trader's fight is not my fight. I leave them to their fate.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEFEND_RES_B_2: Whatever this trader has done, it has upset some dangerous people. I should leave before I upset them too.
data.ALL_TRADER_DEFEND_RES_B_3: I do not want to get mixed up in whatever business has gone on here. I should leave, and quickly.
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_THANK_LANG_1: Thanks for your help with the pirates! Have some stuff!
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_THANK_LANG_2: Thanks for your help with the pirates! Have some stuff!
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_THANK_LANG_3: Thanks for your help with the pirates! Have some stuff!
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_THANK_LANG_1: Thanks for your help with the pirates! Have some stuff!
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_THANK_LANG_2: Thanks for your help with the pirates! Have some stuff!
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_THANK_LANG_3: Thanks for your help with the pirates! Have some stuff!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_THANK_LANG_1: Thanks for your help with the pirates! Have some stuff!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_THANK_LANG_2: Thanks for your help with the pirates! Have some stuff!
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_THANK_LANG_3: Thanks for your help with the pirates! Have some stuff!
data.ALL_TRADER_THANK_DESC_1: The trader thanks me for my help, and offers me a share of their cargo.
data.ALL_TRADER_THANK_DESC_2: The relief on the pilot's face is obvious to see. They offer me a share of their cargo as thanks for my help.
data.ALL_TRADER_THANK_DESC_3: The pilot can finally relax, free from their pursuers. They present me with a gift, a token of thanks for my effort.
data.ALL_TRADER_THANK_DESC_4: Safe at last, the pilot thanks me for my help. They offer my a gift from their cargo hold.
data.ALL_TRADER_THANK_DESC_5: Though their words are unfamiliar, the pilot's face tells their story. Relieved to be rid of the pirates, they prepare to transmit some of their cargo.
data.ALL_TRADER_THANK_RES_A_1: The trader transmits the cargo, happy. It is a small price to pay compared to what they might have lost.
data.ALL_TRADER_THANK_RES_A_2: Grateful, the pilot transmits their cargo. I wish them luck in finding safe habour.
data.ALL_TRADER_THANK_RES_A_3: The trader transmit the cargo and hurries away, relieved that this whole episode is over.
data.ALL_TRADER_THANK_RES_B_1: I decline the trader's offer. Destroying pirates is its own reward.
data.ALL_TRADER_THANK_RES_B_2: I refuse the gift, and wish them luck avoiding pirates in the future.
data.ALL_TRADER_THANK_RES_B_3: I tell the trader to keep their cargo. They'll need all they can to pay for the repair of their ship.
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_OFFLOAD_LANG_2: Too many luxury goods, needs help carrying them
data.DNT_EXP_TRADER_OFFLOAD_LANG_3: I'm a Korvax! Want to buy these specific items?
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_OFFLOAD_LANG_1: I'm a Gek! Want to buy these specific items?
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_OFFLOAD_LANG_2: I'm a Gek! Want to buy these specific items?
data.DNT_TRA_TRADER_OFFLOAD_LANG_3: I'm a Gek! Want to buy these specific items?
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_OFFLOAD_LANG_1: I'm a Vy'keen! Want to buy these specific items?
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_OFFLOAD_LANG_2: I'm a Vy'keen! Want to buy these specific items?
data.DNT_WAR_TRADER_OFFLOAD_LANG_3: I'm a Vy'keen! Want to buy these specific items?
data.ALL_TRADER_OFFLOAD_DESC_1: Excited to see another pilot, the trader offers me one of their collection of rare and precious items.
data.ALL_TRADER_OFFLOAD_DESC_2: The pilot seems like a normal trader, but instead of the usual range of goods, they carry only trinkets and curios. I wonder what lead to such an unusual cargo...
data.ALL_TRADER_OFFLOAD_DESC_3: This trader doesn't speak like the other merchants I've met. They appear to be a specialist, carrying only the most unusual items...
data.ALL_TRADER_OFFLOAD_DESC_4: I do not know exactly who this pilot is. A trader? A historian? A monk of some sort? Either way, they appear to be peddling trinkets.
data.ALL_TRADER_OFFLOAD_DESC_5: The trader transmits their cargo manifest, revealing a strange collection. Their hold is full of relics, items of importance to their people. They appear willing to part with them...
data.ALL_TRADER_OFFLOAD_RES_A_1: I accept the trader's offer. I'm sure I will find a use for this relic.
data.ALL_TRADER_OFFLOAD_RES_A_2: The relic is worth the asking price. Even if I am unsure what exactly it's for, these items are highly valued by the people who live in this system.
data.ALL_TRADER_OFFLOAD_RES_A_3: The trader sends me the relic and leaves, happy to have spread whatever it is they think they're spreading.
data.ALL_TRADER_OFFLOAD_RES_B_1: I decline the trader's strange collection of trinkets.
data.ALL_TRADER_OFFLOAD_RES_B_2: I thank the trader for their offer, but decline to take one of their relics.
data.ALL_TRADER_OFFLOAD_RES_B_3: I have no need of the merchant's relics right now. I thank them for the offer, and end the communication.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_1: Greetings. Are you a customer? Direct purchase is not available at this station.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_2: Merchants Guild trade is only available to registered members. Seek business elsewhere.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_LOW_1: Welcome, trader. Have you brought much to sell?
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_LOW_2: Guild discount is not available to low-ranking members. Sorry.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_MED_1: Greetings, fellow trader. May good deals always find you.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_MED_2: Greetings, fellow trader. May good deals always find you.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_MED_3: Greetings, fellow trader. May good deals always find you.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_HIGH_1: I have heard tell of your deals, merchant.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_HIGH_2: I have heard tell of your deals, merchant.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_HIGH_3: I have heard tell of your deals, merchant.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_BEST_1: I bow before you, Trade Lord.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_BEST_2: I bow before you, Trade Lord.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_BEST_3: I bow before you, Trade Lord.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_BEST_4: I bow before you, Trade Lord.
data.DNT_NPC_TGUILD_GREETING_BEST_5: I bow before you, Trade Lord.
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_1: You are yet to be discovered by the Guild of Explorers.
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_2: You are yet to be discovered by the Guild of Explorers.
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_LOW_1: Welcome, apprentice. Have you discovered much?
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_LOW_2: Welcome, apprentice. Have you discovered much?
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_LOW_3: Welcome, apprentice. Have you discovered much?
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_MED_1: Greetings, fellow explorer. May the fauna be large and the flora bountiful.
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_MED_2: Greetings, fellow explorer. May the fauna be large and the flora bountiful.
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_MED_3: Greetings, fellow explorer. May the fauna be large and the flora bountiful.
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_HIGH_1: I have heard tell of your discoveries, explorer.
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_HIGH_2: I have heard tell of your discoveries, explorer.
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_HIGH_3: I have heard tell of your discoveries, explorer.
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_BEST_1: I salute you and your research!
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_BEST_2: I salute you and your research!
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_BEST_3: I salute you and your research!
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_BEST_4: I salute you and your research!
data.DNT_NPC_EGUILD_GREETING_BEST_5: I salute you and your research!
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_1: Bah! You have not yet earned the respect of the Mercenaries Guild!
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_2: Bah! You have not yet earned the respect of the Mercenaries Guild!
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_LOW_1: How is your body count, warrior? Improving?
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_LOW_2: How is your body count, warrior? Improving?
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_LOW_3: How is your body count, warrior? Improving?
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_MED_1: Welcome, fellow mercenary. Chase our enemies and find good loot!
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_MED_2: Welcome, fellow mercenary. Chase our enemies and find good loot!
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_MED_3: Welcome, fellow mercenary. Chase our enemies and find good loot!
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_HIGH_1: Salutations and respect to such a fine warrior.
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_HIGH_2: Salutations and respect to such a fine warrior.
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_HIGH_3: Salutations and respect to such a fine warrior.
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_BEST_1: I bow before you, supreme commander!
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_BEST_2: I bow before you, supreme commander!
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_BEST_3: I bow before you, supreme commander!
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_BEST_4: I bow before you, supreme commander!
data.DNT_NPC_WGUILD_GREETING_BEST_5: I bow before you, supreme commander!
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_DESC_1:
Though their words are unclear, the badge on the lifeform's uniform is unmistakable. They are an envoy of the Merchant's Guild.
They do not seem particularly interested in trading with me, however.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_DESC_2:
I have seen this alien's insignia before. They are a member of the Merchants Guild.
They do not seem to have any business for me at the moment. Perhaps the <SPECIAL>Mission Listings Agent<> on the station might have a way to prove my worth?
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_LOW_DESC_1: I recognise this alien as a fellow trader, another member of the Merchants Guild.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_LOW_DESC_2: Their keen mercantile eyes give this lifeform away as a member of the Merchants Guild, a fellow trader looking to make their way in the galaxy.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_LOW_DESC_3: The lifeform bows gently, more in ritual than respect. They flash their badge, revealing themselves as the Merchants Guild representative in this system.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_MED_DESC_1: The alien, who appears to be the Merchant Guild envoy in this system, scanned me subtly as I approached. Having seen my rank with the Guild, they apologise for the intrusion and greet me with warmth.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_MED_DESC_2:
The alien transmits a short data sequence, revealing themselves as the Merchants Guild's official representative in this system.
Despite their apparent friendliness, I cannot help but think they are assessing me, working out how to best me in a deal.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_MED_DESC_3: The lifeform nods at me. I do not believe I have met them before, but they clearly recognise me. They must be the Merchants Guild representative in this system.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_HIGH_DESC_1: The alien greets me warmly. They work for the Merchants Guild, keeping an eye on business in this system. They have a message to relay.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_HIGH_DESC_2: The lifeform identifies themself as the Merchants Guild representative in this system. We perform the mutual exchange of units that Guild protocol demands.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_HIGH_DESC_3: The lifeform shows their identification, the badge of a middle-ranking envoy of the Merchants Guild. They bow, pleased to have me visit their system.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_BEST_DESC_1: The lifeform, an envoy of the Merchants Guild, seems excited to see me. They give a short, hesitant gesture, as if apologising for the lack of wealth and status in their system.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_BEST_DESC_2: The alien jabbers excitedly, transmitting a sequence of recent profitable deals. They are the Merchants Guild envoy in this system, and keen to impress.
data.NPC_TGUILD_GREET_BEST_DESC_3: The lifeform greets me as a high-ranking member of the Merchants Guild, performing the special gestures required at such a meeting.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_DESC_1:
The lifeform carries both the badge of the Explorers Guild and the worldly pose of one who has broken ground on many strange planets.
For a supposedly curious lifeform, I do not seem to provoked much interest. Perhaps they deem me unworthy of study.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_DESC_2:
I have seen this alien's insignia before. They are a member of the Explorers Guild.
They do not seem interested in the data I have to offer. Perhaps the <SPECIAL>Mission Listings Agent<> on the station might have a way to prove my worth?
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_LOW_DESC_1: The lifeform examines me before revealing their credentials as a member of the Explorers Guild.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_LOW_DESC_2: The alien reveals themselves as an envoy of the Explorers Guild. They appear to be assessing me, but to what end? To learn my worth as an explorer, or simply as an object of curiosity?
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_LOW_DESC_3: The lifeform presents their Explorers Guild credentials, showing themselves as the official envoy for this system. For some reason, they also transmit a detailed record of every plant they've ever discovered.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_MED_DESC_1: The lifeform flashes a small holographic display, a 3D token of their status as the Explorers Guild envoy in this system.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_MED_DESC_2: The alien reveals their Explorers Guild credentials, the paperwork of an official envoy.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_MED_DESC_3: The lifeform shows their identification as an official of the Explorers Guild, but not before attempting to scan me for data.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_HIGH_DESC_1: The lifeform jabbers excitedly, happy to share their latest research with a fellow member of the Explorer's Guild.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_HIGH_DESC_2: The alien reveals themselves as an explorer of some standing with the Guild. They welcome me to their system.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_HIGH_DESC_3: The lifeform greets me warmly, revealing themselves as the Explorers Guild's leading researcher in this system.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_BEST_DESC_1: The lifeform subjects me to a brief analysis before bowing deeply. They are the official Explorers Guild representative in this system.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_BEST_DESC_2: The alien greets me with a selection of interesting images taken in this system. As the Explorers Guild envoy here, they are keen that I see the sights.
data.NPC_EGUILD_GREET_BEST_DESC_3: The lifeform scans me, scans themselves, and finally scans the Explorers Guild insignia they have projected in front of them. The ritual over, they bow before me.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_DESC_1: The alien's aggressive tone and rough demeanor mark them out as a mercenary. I hope they are here in some official capacity, rather than undertaking a mission.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_UNKNOWN_DESC_2:
The lifeform glares at me briefly, shaking their head. They seem to be a representative of the Guild of Mercenaries.
Perhaps I could impress them by undertaking work from the <SPECIAL>Mission Listings Agent<>?
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_LOW_DESC_1: The alien gives a terse salute. Their insignia is of a middle-ranking officer of the Mercenaries Guild.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_LOW_DESC_2: The lifeform barks at me in a grumpy tone. Their badge shows them as an envoy of the Mercenaries Guild.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_LOW_DESC_3: The alien looks at me, disappointed. They are an official of the Mercenaries Guild, and I think they expected me to salute.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_MED_DESC_1: The alien, wearing the uniform of a Mercenaries Guild envoy, looks me up and down. I appear to pass muster.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_MED_DESC_2: The lifeform, a gruff look upon their face, welcomes me to the system on behalf of the Mercenaries Guild.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_MED_DESC_3: The lifeform makes a gesture of respect, an acknowledgement from one Mercenaries Guild operative to another.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_HIGH_DESC_1: The lifeform wears the insignia of the Mercenaries Guild, and stands to attention as I approach.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_HIGH_DESC_2: The alien, scarred from battle, salutes me as I approach. They are the Mercenaries Guild commander in this system.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_HIGH_DESC_3: The lifeform, with their neatly pressed uniform and alert, precise mannerisms, welcomes me to the system on behalf of the local Mercenaries Guild.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_BEST_DESC_1: The lifeform snaps to attention as soon as they see me. Their Mercenaries Guild badge has been polished so vigourously that I can see my reflection in it.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_BEST_DESC_2: The lifeform makes a great show of their salute. As the official Mercenaries Guild envoy in this system, it is their duty to receive high-ranking members in a fitting style.
data.NPC_WGUILD_GREET_BEST_DESC_3: The alien wears the badge of a Mercenaries Guild commander. They give me a particularly energetic salute.
data.DNT_NPC_GUILD_MISSION_OFFER_1: The guild have a special mission for you

data.DNT_NPC_GUILD_MISSION_OFFER_5: The guild have a special mission for you
data.DNT_NPC_GUILD_TITHE_OFFER_1: The guild want you to have this share of recent profits
data.DNT_NPC_GUILD_TITHE_OFFER_2: The guild want you to have this share of recent profits

data.DNT_NPC_GUILD_TITHE_OFFER_5: The guild want you to have this share of recent profits
data.DNT_NPC_GUILD_PRESENT_OFFER_1: I have a present for you, from one guild member to another
data.DNT_NPC_GUILD_PRESENT_OFFER_2: I have a present for you, from one guild member to another
data.DNT_NPC_GUILD_PRESENT_OFFER_3: I have a present for you, from one guild member to another
data.DNT_NPC_GUILD_PRESENT_OFFER_4: I have a present for you, from one guild member to another
data.DNT_NPC_GUILD_PRESENT_OFFER_5: I have a present for you, from one guild member to another
data.NPC_GUILD_MISSION_OFFER_DESC_1: They appear to have some special Guild business that needs attending to, and request my assistance.
data.NPC_GUILD_MISSION_OFFER_DESC_2: They hesitate, clearing hoping I will assist them with some official Guild business.
data.NPC_GUILD_MISSION_OFFER_DESC_3: They transmit specific data, a mission that they cannot entrust to the listings agent. They hope I will be of assistance.
data.NPC_GUILD_MISSION_OFFER_DESC_4: They appear to have a problem client, one with a task they feel they can only entrust to a Guild member in good standing.
data.NPC_GUILD_MISSION_OFFER_DESC_5: They offer me the chance to take on a particularly lucrative mission, a task for a favoured client.
data.NPC_GUILD_TITHE_OFFER_DESC_1: They have no particular business for me today, but are pleased to be able to present me my share of local operating profits.
data.NPC_GUILD_TITHE_OFFER_DESC_2: The Guild here has no special tasks at the moment, but they have had a recent windfall. They are sharing the loot with all Guild members.
data.NPC_GUILD_TITHE_OFFER_DESC_3: They present me with my share of recent Guild profits, accounting for my rank.
data.NPC_GUILD_TITHE_OFFER_DESC_4: Their greeting over, the envoy turns to business. They tally up what I am due from the Guild, my share of recent profits minus membership fees owed.
data.NPC_GUILD_TITHE_OFFER_DESC_5: They present me with an itemised list, a transaction record for the Guild's local operations. They offer me a sum of money, my share of the profits.
data.NPC_GUILD_PRESENT_OFFER_DESC_1: They offer me a present, a product of the local system that they hope will assist me in my work.
data.NPC_GUILD_PRESENT_OFFER_DESC_2: They have no specific work for me at the moment. They seem apologetic, and offer me a small gift as recompense.
data.NPC_GUILD_PRESENT_OFFER_DESC_3: The Guild here has matters in hand, and has no need of any special operations. However, the envoy does have a gift for me, to mark the occasion.
data.NPC_GUILD_PRESENT_OFFER_DESC_4: The Guild here is flourishing, and all members are being offered gifts as thanks for their work. The envoy presents me with an item they claim to have picked out for me specially.
data.NPC_GUILD_PRESENT_OFFER_DESC_5: They make a great show of presenting me with a gift, an item acquired by a Guild operative on a recent mission.
data.NPC_GUILD_ACCEPT_GIFT_RES_1: I accept the envoy's gift, and make a gesture of thanks.
data.NPC_GUILD_ACCEPT_GIFT_RES_2: I take the present, thanking the Guild and its official.
data.NPC_GUILD_ACCEPT_GIFT_RES_3: I take the gift, and promise to commend the envoy's work to their superiors.
data.NPC_GUILD_DECLINE_MISSION_RES_1: I turn down their mission. I have other things that need doing.
data.NPC_GUILD_DECLINE_MISSION_RES_2: I decline their task. The client will have to wait.
data.NPC_GUILD_DECLINE_MISSION_RES_3: I decline to help the envoy with their task. I hope they will not be offended.
data.NPC_GUILD_DECLINE_GIFT_RES_1: I turn down their offer. I am a member of the Guild, but it does not define me. I take nothing, I owe nothing.
data.NPC_GUILD_DECLINE_GIFT_RES_2: I decline their offer. I do not need the Guild's assistance.
data.NPC_GUILD_DECLINE_GIFT_RES_3: I reject the envoy's present. They seem offended.
data.NPC_GUILD_SECONDARY_DESC_1: The envoy looks busy. I should leave them be.
data.NPC_GUILD_SECONDARY_DESC_2: I should leave %NAME% be. They have important Guild business to attend to, no doubt.
data.NPC_GUILD_SECONDARY_DESC_3: The Guild envoy in this system has nothing more to offer me.
data.NPC_GUILD_SECONDARY_DESC_4: %NAME% has plenty of Guild business to work on without repeating information for me.
data.NPC_GUILD_SECONDARY_DESC_5: I have caused enough excitement for %NAME% already. I should let them get on with their other Guild work.
